acnet2.Status info: GENESIS version stable. In the process of converting to neuroConstruct/NeuroML.
acnet2.name: Primary Auditory Cortex network

alleninstituteneuroml.Status info: In development. Work underway to incorporate data from [Allen Institute Cell Types database](http://celltypes.brain-map.org)
alleninstituteneuroml.name: Allen Institute & NeuroML

almog-korngreen-pyramidal-neuron.Status info: In development. Channels converted to NeuroML (and NeuroML2 wherever necessary). It is possible to reproduce the results from the ModelDB version via the NeuroConstruct  project.
almog-korngreen-pyramidal-neuron.description:
Conversion to neuroConstruct and NeuroML of the L5 Pyramidal cell model described in:

Almog M, Korngreen A (2014) [A Quantitative Description of Dendritic Conductances and Its Application to Dendritic Excitation in Layer 5 Pyramidal Neurons](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/34/1/182) J Neurosci 34(1):182-196
almog-korngreen-pyramidal-neuron.name: L5 Pyramidal Neuron - Almog and Korngreen 2014

bahletal2012_reducedl5pyrcell.name: Reduced L5 Pyramidal Cell - Bahl et al. 2012

blender-to-neuroml.Status info: Scripts being updated for NeuroML generation from Blender
blender-to-neuroml.description: Test of Blender to NeuroML conversion
blender-to-neuroml.name: Blender to NeuroML for C elegans connectome

blue-brain-project-showcase.Status info: Conversion of cell models from NMC to NeuroML2 completed
blue-brain-project-showcase.Tags: Detailed cell model,Pyramidal cell,Neuronal reconstruction,Large scale brain initiative
blue-brain-project-showcase.name: Blue Brain Project Showcase

brunel2000.Status info: PyNN version here has been taken from the standard PyNN examples.
brunel2000.Tags: Point neuron network,Integrate and fire neuron
brunel2000.name: Sparsely connected spiking neuron network - Brunel 2000

CA1 Oriens Lacunosum Moleculare multi-compartment model:
Lawrence JJ, Saraga F, Churchill JF, Statland JM, Travis KE, Skinner FK, McBain CJ (2006) Somatodendritic Kv7-KCNQ-M channels control interspike interval in hippocampal interneurons. J Neurosci 26:12325-38
ca1-oriens-lacunosum-moleculare-lawrence.name: CA1 Oriens Lacunosum Moleculare - Lawrence et al. 2006

ca1-oriens-lacunosum-moleculare-saraga-e.description:
CA1 Oriens Lacunosum Moleculare multi-compartment model:
Saraga F, Wu CP, Zhang L, Skinner FK (2003) Active Dendrites and Spike Propagation in Multi-compartment Models of Oriens-Lacunosum/Moleculare Hippocampal Interneurons. J Physiol 552(3):673-689
ca1-oriens-lacunosum-moleculare-saraga-e.name: CA1 Oriens Lacunosum Moleculare - Saraga et al. 2003

ca1pyramidalcell.Status info:
This model has been fully converted to *NeuroML version 1.8.1*. This process was described in Gleeson et al. 2010 (http://www.ploscompbiol.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pcbi.1000815).

This model can currently be executed in *NEURON*, *GENESIS*, *MOOSE* and *PSICS*. It can also be exported to pure NeuroML2 and from there converted to NEURON using jNeuroML.
ca1pyramidalcell.description:
![](/attachments/download/1/CA1-spike.PNG)
Conversion of [hippocampal CA1 pyramidal cell](http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Hippocampus_CA1_pyramidal_cell) from [Migliore et al 2005](http://senselab.med.yale.edu/ModelDB/ShowModel.asp?model=55035).

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/CA1PyramidalCell.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/CA1PyramidalCell)
ca1pyramidalcell.name: CA1 Pyramidal Cell - Migliore et al. 2005

catmaidshowcase.Status info: Only contains some example exported morphologies so far
catmaidshowcase.description: Project for example NeuroML files generated by [CATMAID](http://www.catmaid.org).
catmaidshowcase.name: CATMAID Showcase

celegans.Status info:
*This model is still very much in the early stages of development.* 

While the individual cell morphologies are in NeuroML, and the connectivity can be generated in neuroConstruct using real connection data, a full spiking model requires much more information about the electrical properties of neurons in C. elegans
celegans.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/22/medium.png)

**The latest version of this model can be found at http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/c302**
Note: the development of the OpenWorm model of [C. elegans](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caenorhabditis_elegans) is taking place at [http://www.openworm.org](http://www.openworm.org).

A full list of those involved in that project can be found [here](http://www.openworm.org/people.html).

The C. elegans 3D model this was derived from was produced by Dr. Christian Grove and Dr. Paul Sternberg at the VirtualWorm project (WormBase, CalTech) and released into the public domain. You can visit the VirtualWorm home page at http://caltech.wormbase.org/virtualworm/ .

For details on running this neuroConstruct project see: https://github.com/openworm/OpenWorm/wiki/Running-the-C.-elegans-model-in-neuroConstruct.

This is a **work in progress**. Please [get in contact](http://www.openworm.org/contacts.html) for more information.
celegans.name: OpenWorm C. elegans network model

cerebellarnucleusneuron.Status info:
The original source code for this model in *GENESIS* is available on the OSB [here](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/cerebellarnucleusneuron/repository/revisions/master/show/GENESIS). A slightly modified version of this model has also been created in *NEURON* by the original developers [here](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/cerebellarnucleusneuron/repository/revisions/master/show/NEURON).

Conversion of this model to NeuroML is underway. A subset of the channels have been converted (see [here](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/cerebellarnucleusneuron/repository/revisions/master/show/neuroConstruct/cellMechanisms)). Most channels in the original model can be expressed in *NeuroML version 1.x*, but the GHK based current will require *NeuroML v2.0*.
cerebellarnucleusneuron.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/34/medium.png)

[Deep cerebellar nucleus neuron](http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Cerebellum_nucleus_reciprocal_projections_neuron) model from: Determinants of synaptic integration and heterogeneity in rebound firing explored with data-driven models of deep cerebellar nucleus cells. Steuber V, Schultheiss NW, Silver RA, De Schutter E, Jaeger D. J Comput Neurosci. 2011 Jun;30(3):633-58
cerebellarnucleusneuron.name: Cerebellar Nucleus Neuron - Steuber et al. 2011

cerebellum--cerebellar-golgi-cell--solin.Status info: Well tested NeuroML v1.8.1 -> NEURON. KAHP channel with kinetic scheme formalism precludes use on GENESIS/MOOSE for now.
cerebellum--cerebellar-golgi-cell--solin.description:
Multicompartmental model of cerebellar Golgi cell from: Solinas S, Forti L, Cesana E, Mapelli J, De Schutter E, D’Angelo E. **Computational reconstruction of pacemaking and intrinsic electroresponsiveness in cerebellar Golgi cells**. [Front Cell Neurosci. 2007;1:2](http://journal.frontiersin.org/article/10.3389/neuro.03.002.2007/abstract). 

Based on implementation in NEURON taken from: http://senselab.med.yale.edu/modeldb/ShowModel.asp?model=112685.
cerebellum--cerebellar-golgi-cell--solin.name: Cerebellar Golgi Cell - Solinas et al. 2007

channelworm.description: An OpenWorm repository to integrate data, information, scripts, and models of ion channels in C. elegans
channelworm.name: ChannelWorm

cnoshowcase.Status info: Simple script written. Yann Le Franc will manually add CNO Ids to text file which will be updated on each OSB project.
cnoshowcase.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/103/CNO_image.jpg)
Scripts for interacting with the Computational Neuroscience Ontology:
http://www.incf.org/programs/modeling/cno

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
cnoshowcase.name: Computational Neuroscience Ontology Showcase

csashowcase.Status info: A number of example scripts are available showing basic CSA functionality and its use in PyNN scripts (which can be exported to NeuroML 2).
csashowcase.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/csashowcase/repository/revisions/master/entry/images/gaussian_sm.png)

A project highlighting some of the features of the [Connection Set Algebra](http://software.incf.org/software/csa) library, and how it can interact with NeuroML & PyNN.

For more details see the [[Wiki]].
csashowcase.name: Connection Set Algebra Showcase

dentate.Status info: NEURON scripts are based on Schneider et al 2012. In parallel to the ongoing development of this, the neuroConstruct project contains the cell models in NeuroML format (not yet complete).
dentate.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/109/DG_500.jpg)

Dentate Gyrus network model developed by the [Soltesz lab](http://www.ivansolteszlab.org). This is an ongoing update to the large scale dentate gyrus model presented in Schneider CJ, Bezaire M, Soltesz I.
Toward a full-scale computational model of the rat dentate gyrus. Front Neural Circuits. (2012) 6:83.


See also [CA1 Local Network, Bezaire and Soltesz 2013](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/nc_ca1) and [CA1 Pyramidal Sublayer Microcircuit, Lee et al 2014](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/nc_superdeep) from the [Soltesz lab](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/groups/201).
dentate.name: Dentate Gyrus network model - Soltesz lab

dentategyrus2005.Status info:
Model mostly converted to neuroConstruct. Some channels have been converted to NeuroML format. 

NOTE Work on this project will halt in favour of: http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/dentate
dentategyrus2005.name: Dentate Gyrus - Santhakumar et al 2005

destexhe_jcns_2009.Tags: Point neuron network,Adaptive exponential integrate and fire neuron
destexhe_jcns_2009.description:
Network simulations of self-sustained activity in networks of adaptive exponential integrate and fire neurons.

From: Self-sustained asynchronous irregular states and Up–Down states in thalamic, cortical and thalamocortical networks of nonlinear integrate-and-fire neurons, Alain Destexhe, [J Comp Neuroscience 2009](http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs10827-009-0164-4)
destexhe_jcns_2009.name: Self Sustained Network Activity - Destexhe 2009

dlgninterneuronhalnesetal2011.description: A multi-compartment model for interneurons in the dLGN
dlgninterneuronhalnesetal2011.name: dLGN Interneuron - Halnes et al 2011

drosophila_projection_neuron.Status info:
In early stages of development!

This version basically represents an export of the model from NEURON into NeuroML and import into neuroConstruct.
drosophila_projection_neuron.description:
![](/attachments/download/50/Selection_140.png)

In early stages of development!

Cell model based on pubmed:19439602.
drosophila_projection_neuron.name: Drosophila Projection Neuron - Gouwens and Wilson, 2009

ebneretal2019.name: Ebner et al. 2019 - Unified synaptic plasticity model

farinellaetal_nmdaspikes.Status info: In the process of being cleaned up/annotated. The cell model can be found in: [Synaptic integration in L5 Pyramidal cell, Larkum et al. 2009](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/larkumetal2009).
farinellaetal_nmdaspikes.description:
Model from: **Glutamate-bound NMDARs arising from in vivo-like network activity extend spatio-temporal integration in a L5 cortical pyramidal cell model**
Matteo Farinella, Daniel T. Ruedt, Padraig Gleeson, Frederic Lanore and
R. Angus Silver

This paper has just [been published](http://www.ploscompbiol.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pcbi.1003590).

The cell model used is based on: [Synaptic integration in L5 Pyramidal cell, Larkum et al. 2009](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/larkumetal2009)
farinellaetal_nmdaspikes.name: NMDA spikes in L5 Pyramidal cells - Farinella et al 2014

fast-genesis-vogels-abbott-model.Tags: Single compartment conductance based neuron model,Synaptic plasticity
fast-genesis-vogels-abbott-model.description:
This is an improved and much more efficient GENESIS implementation of
the dual exponential conductance version of the Vogels-Abbott (2005)
network model with Hodgkin-Huxley neurons and conductance-based
synaptic activation (COBA). Details are given in Brette et al. (2007).
It uses hsolve and runs 16 times faster than the original. The
‘VAnet2-batch.g’ script is intended to be extended for testing GENESIS
spike timing dependent plasticity (STDP) implementations with hsolve.
fast-genesis-vogels-abbott-model.name: VAnet2-GENESIS

fitzhugh-nagumo-fitzhugh-1969.Status info: Stable. This model has been incorporated into the core of NeuroML 2 for the v2beta4 release.
fitzhugh-nagumo-fitzhugh-1969.name: FitzHugh Nagumo - FitzHugh 1969

fpgashowcase.description:
Information on various packages available for executing neuronal simulations on FPGA boards.

For more information, see the [[Wiki]].
fpgashowcase.name: FPGA Based Simulations Showcase

functional-balanced-network.description: Orientation selectivity in inhibition-dominated networks of spiking neurons
functional-balanced-network.name: Functional Balanced Network

geppettoshowcase.description:
![](/attachments/download/210/geppettologo.png)

Geppetto is a web-based multi-algorithm, multi-scale simulation platform engineered to support the simulation of complex biological systems and their surrounding environment.

Examples of NeuroML 2 files along with scripts for visualising/executing them in Geppetto (http://www.geppetto.org).
geppettoshowcase.name: Geppetto Showcase

ghk-nernst.description:
Examples of cell models with currents using the [GHK flux equation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GHK_flux_equation), or using
 [Nernst’s Equation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nernst_equation) for the reversal potential in NeuroML 2 and a number of other formats.

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
ghk-nernst.name: GHK & Nernst examples

golgicelldendgapjunctions.Status info: Original scripts added. Some morphologies exported to NeuroML 2
golgicelldendgapjunctions.name: Golgi Cell Dendritic Gap Junctions - Szoboszlay et al. 2016

grancelllayer.Status info: Stable implementation on NEURON and GENESIS
grancelllayer.Tags: NMDAR synapse,Single compartment conductance based neuron model,neuroConstruct
grancelllayer.name: Granule Cell Layer - Maex and De Schutter 1998

grancellrothmanif.Status info: The model is conceptually stable, but less so as far as the implementation is concerned. Currently, development is focused on ensuring that most of the simulation configurations defined in this neuroConstruct project run as intended in both NEURON and jLEMS (via NeuroMLv2 export).
grancellrothmanif.description: This project contains an integrate and fire model of the cerebellar granule cell and a simple model of the mossy fibre to granule cell synapse. The cell model (IaF\_GrC.nml) is the average (ie the one whose parameters have the average value) of the model population developed by Jason Rothman and published in Schwartz et, J Neurosci (2012). The synaptic model is based on the one used in that same paper, but it has been developed further to improve the fit to the experimental data and to ensure LEMS/NeuroMLv2 compatibility.
grancellrothmanif.name: I&F granule cell model - Rothman & Piasini

grancellsolinasetal10.Status info: In the process of conversion from original NEURON to NeuroML. Temperature dependence of channel conductances (see [here](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/grancellsolinasetal10/repository/revisions/master/entry/NEURON/GRANULE_NA.mod#L82)) will require implementation in NeuroML 2, but initial impl in NeuroML v1.8.1, fixed at 30 deg C is present in [neuroConstruct folder](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/grancellsolinasetal10/repository/revisions/master/show/neuroConstruct).
grancellsolinasetal10.Tags: NMDAR synapse,Single compartment conductance based neuron model,neuroConstruct
grancellsolinasetal10.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/24/solinasal10.png)
Initial version of Granule cell from: Solinas S., Nieus T, d’Angelo E. (2010) **A Realistic Large-Scale Model of the Cerebellum Granular Layer Predicts Circuit Spatio-Temporal Filtering Properties**. Front Cell Neurosci. 2010;4:12.

For more information, see the [[Wiki]]

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.com/OpenSourceBrain/GranCellSolinasEtAl10.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.com/OpenSourceBrain/GranCellSolinasEtAl10)
grancellsolinasetal10.name: Cerebellar Granule Cell - Solinas et al. 2010

granularlayersolinasnieusdangelo2010.Status info: Currently being converted to Python scripts based on NeuroML v2
granularlayersolinasnieusdangelo2010.description: Cerebellar granular layer network model from: Solinas S., Nieus T, d'Angelo E. (2010) [A Realistic Large-Scale Model of the Cerebellum Granular Layer Predicts Circuit Spatio-Temporal Filtering Properties](http://journal.frontiersin.org/article/10.3389/fncel.2010.00012/abstract). Front Cell Neurosci. 2010;4:12.
granularlayersolinasnieusdangelo2010.name: Granular Layer Network Model - Solinas, Nieus & D'Angelo 2010

granule-cell-layer-piasini-2014.Tags: Point neuron network,NMDAR synapse,AMPAR synapse,neuroConstruct,Integrate and fire neuron,Synaptic plasticity
granule-cell-layer-piasini-2014.description:
github:README.md

This model has been used in pubmed:25123311.
granule-cell-layer-piasini-2014.name: Granule Cell Layer - Piasini et al.

granulecell.Status info:
Stable implementation in NeuroML mapping to NEURON, GENESIS and MOOSE.

This model is being used to test mapping of single compartment conductance based models to other simulators using [jNeuroML](https://github.com/NeuroML/jNeuroML).
granulecell.Tags: Single compartment conductance based neuron model,neuroConstruct
granulecell.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/25/shutter98.png)
A project illustrating the behaviour of the cerebellar granule cell model from: Maex, R and De Schutter, E. [Synchronization of Golgi and Granule Cell Firing in a Detailed Network Model of the Cerebellar Granule Cell Layer](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9819260) J Neurophysiol, Nov 1998; 80: 2521 - 2537. 

Based on scripts obtained from: http://www.tnb.ua.ac.be/models/network.shtml.

For more details see the [[Wiki]].

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/GranuleCell.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/GranuleCell)
granulecell.name: Cerebellar Granule Cell - Maex De Schutter 1998

granulecellvscs.Status info: Originally developed in NEURON. Converted to NeuroML v1.8.1.
granulecellvscs.Tags: Single compartment conductance based neuron model,neuroConstruct
granulecellvscs.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/26/steubersaviane.png)
Conversion to NeuroML of a model granule cell developed by Volker Steuber and Chiara Saviane (Silver lab).

Based on a Granule cell model from Michiel Berends, Neural Comp 15, 2531-47 (2005) originally modified by Chiara Saviane and further modified by VS, July 2006.
granulecellvscs.name: Granule Cell - Steuber, Saviane & Berends

hindmarshrose1984.description:
The Hindmarsh Rose model consists of a fast spiking subsystem, which is a generalization of the Fitzhugh-Nagumo (aka Bonhoeffer-van der Pol) oscillator, coupled to a slower subsystem which allows the system to fire bursts of spikes.

Implemented according to:
Hindmarsh J. L., and Rose R. M. (1984) A model of neuronal bursting using three coupled first order differential equations. Proc. R. Soc. London, Ser. B 221:87–102.
hindmarshrose1984.name: Hindmarsh and Rose 1984

hodgkin-huxley-tutorial.Status info: Stable. Developed initially by members of the OpenWorm community.
hodgkin-huxley-tutorial.name: Hodgkin Huxley Tutorial

izhikevichmodel.Status info: The Izhikevich model is supported by NeuroML v2.0 and PyNN 0.8. This project will demonstrate all of the main [firing behaviours](http://izhikevich.org/publications/whichmod.htm) of this cell model.
izhikevichmodel.Tags: Google Summer of Code,Izhikevich neuron model,Abstract neuron model
izhikevichmodel.name: Izhikevich Spiking Neuron Model

joglekaretal18.description:
# JoglekarEtAl18

Inter-areal Balanced Amplification Enhances Signal Propagation in a Large-Scale Circuit Model of the Primate Cortex
Madhura R. Joglekar, Jorge F. Mejia
s, Guangyu Robert Yang, Xiao-Jing Wang

https://www.cell.com/neuron/fulltext/S0896-6273(18)30152-1
joglekaretal18.name: Large-Scale Circuit Model of the Primate Cortex - Joglekar et al. 2018

l23dendriticspikes.name: Dendritic spikes in L2/3 pyramidal cells - Smith et al. 2013

l5bpyrcellhayetal2011.description:
![](https://raw.github.com/OpenSourceBrain/L5bPyrCellHayEtAl2011/master/neuroConstruct/images/large.png)
Layer 5b Pyramidal cell constrained by experimental data on perisomatic firing properties as well as dendritic activity during backpropagation of the action potential.


From: **Models of Neocortical Layer 5b Pyramidal Cells Capturing a Wide Range of Dendritic and Perisomatic Active Properties**, Etay Hay, Sean Hill, Felix Schürmann, Henry Markram and Idan Segev, [PLoS Comp Biol 2011](http://www.ploscompbiol.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pcbi.1002107)

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/L5bPyrCellHayEtAl2011.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/OpenSourceBrain/L5bPyrCellHayEtAl2011)
l5bpyrcellhayetal2011.name: Layer 5b Pyramidal cell - Hay et al. 2011

larkumetal2009.Status info: Almost completely converted to NeuroML v1.x
larkumetal2009.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/172/L5Spike.png)

Conversion to neuroConstruct/NeuroML of Layer 5 Pyramidal cell model from:

Larkum ME, Nevian T, Sandler M, Polsky A, Schiller J (2009) Synaptic
integration in tuft dendrites of layer 5 pyramidal neurons: a new
unifying principle. Science 325:756-60
larkumetal2009.name: Synaptic integration in L5 Pyramidal cell - Larkum et al. 2009

m1networkmodel.Status info: Working on conversion of model to NeuroML 2 via export from NetPyNE
m1networkmodel.name: M1 Network Model

mainenetalpyramidalcell.Status info: Converted to NeuroML v1.8.1. Close agreement between NEURON & GENESIS mappings
mainenetalpyramidalcell.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/27/mainen95.png)

Implementation of the Mainen et al. pyramidal cell model from: Mainen ZF, Joerges J, Huguenard JR, Sejnowski TJ (1995) A model of spike initiation in neocortical pyramidal neurons. [Neuron 15:1427-39](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8845165). This project is based on scripts obtained from: http://senselab.med.yale.edu/senselab/modeldb/ShowModel.asp?model=8210
mainenetalpyramidalcell.name: L5 Pyramidal Cell - Mainen et al. 1995

mejiasetal2016.name: Large scale laminar cortical network - Mejias et al. 2016

miglioreetal14_olfactorybulb3d.Status info: Conversion of the model to NeuroML2 has begun
miglioreetal14_olfactorybulb3d.name: 3D Olfactory Bulb - Migliore et al. 2014

modeldbshowcase.description: OSB Showcase project for investigating options for interactions between [ModelDB](http://senselab.med.yale.edu/modeldb/) and OSB
modeldbshowcase.name: ModelDB Showcase

morrislecarmodel.description:
Definition in LEMS/NeuroML 2 of the Morris Lecar Model. Code originally contributed by Daniel Salles Chevitarese and Yiyin Zhou.

For more information & latest status, see the [[Wiki]]
morrislecarmodel.name: Morris Lecar Model

mouselightshowcase.Status info: A number of reconstructed morphologies have been converted to NeuroML v2
mouselightshowcase.name: MouseLight Showcase

multicompgrc.description:
Multicompartmental cerebellar granule cell model.

Based on: Diwakar S, Magistretti J, Goldfarb M, Naldi G, D\`Angelo E (2009) Axonal Na+ channels ensure fast spike activation and back-propagation in cerebellar granule cells J Neurophysiol 101(2):519-32
multicompgrc.name: Multicompartmental granule cell - Diwakar et al. 2009

multiscaleisn.description: Inhibition Stabilized Networks at multiple scales based on Sadeh et al. 2017
multiscaleisn.name: MultiscaleISN

muscle_model.Status info: In development - multiple approaches being taken, pure NEURON, NeuroML 2, libNeuroML/Pyramidal. See commit messages for individual directories for more information.
muscle_model.description:
![](http://www.openworm.org/img/OpenWormLogo.png)

This project is being developed as part of the [OpenWorm](http://www.openworm.org) project. This is an attempt to convert the model of [Boyle & Cohen, 2008](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0303264708001408) into NeuroML format for use on NEURON and other simulators.

See [here](/projects/muscle_model/wiki) for more details.
muscle_model.name: Muscle cell model - Boyle & Cohen 2008

musicshowcase.description:
[MUlti-SImulation Coordinator, MUSIC, ](http://incf.org/core/programs/modeling/projects/music/music-multi-simulation-coordinator/) is a software that allows large scale neuron simulators to communicate during runtime.

This OSB Showcase project will highlight some of the examples in development to illustrate its functionality.
musicshowcase.name: MUSIC Showcase

nc_ca1.Tags: Hippocampal formation,Interneuron,Detailed cell model,Pyramidal cell,Large scale network simulation,Google Summer of Code,CA1,High Performance Computing,Network oscillations
nc_ca1.description: CA1 Network Model - Bezaire et al 2016
nc_ca1.name: CA1 Network Model - Bezaire et al 2016

nc_superdeep.Status info: A number of elements of the model are available in the repository. More will be added in time. The original NEURON code will be used as the basis of the conversion to NeuroML/neuroConstruct.
nc_superdeep.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/204/Figure1B.jpg)

This model examines the interactions between the pyramidal cells of the superficial and deep layers of CA1. It is featured in: pubmed:24836505. Specifically, this model shows how the experimentally observed differences in synapse strength and number between PV+ basket cells and either superficial and deep pyramidal cells could have significant effects at the network level.
nc_superdeep.name: CA1 Pyramidal Sublayer Microcircuit - Lee et al 2014

nengoneuroml.Tags: Simulator showcase,Python tools for computational neuroscience,Large scale network simulation
nengoneuroml.description:
![](http://nengo.ca/sites/nengo.ca/files/logo_ctn.png)

Project to test scenarios for NeuroML & [Nengo](http://nengo.ca) interoperability
nengoneuroml.name: Nengo - NeuroML interoperability

neuroconstructshowcase.Status info: Stable, tested projects which run on "the latest version of neuroConstruct":https://github.com/NeuralEnsemble/neuroConstruct.
neuroconstructshowcase.description:
![](/attachments/download/111/logoMain.png)

Example projects illustrating the functionality of [neuroConstruct](http://www.neuroconstruct.org/)
neuroconstructshowcase.name: neuroConstruct Showcase

neuroelectrosciunit.Status info:
In early stages of development.

See "here":https://github.com/cyrus-/sciunit/tree/master/sciunit/test/neurounit for more details.
neuroelectrosciunit.description:
![](/images/neuroelectro_logo.png)

A project highlighting some of the possible interactions between OSB and [NeuroElectro](http://neuroelectro.org/) and [SciUnit](https://github.com/rgerkin/sciunit).

NeuroElectro is one of the key external resources OSB will interact with, see [Interactions with other Neuroinformatics resources](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/neuroinformatics/wiki/Wiki)
neuroelectrosciunit.name: NeuroElectro & SciUnit Showcase

neuroml2.description: The standard examples for NeuroML 2 from the repository for the specification.
neuroml2.name: NeuroML2 Showcase

neuromorpho.Status info: Some morphologies added already. More will be added over time.
neuromorpho.name: NeuroMorpho.Org Showcase

neurosciences-repository.description: Reproduction of a model of action selection in the basal ganglia (Guthrie et al., 2013)
neurosciences-repository.name: Action Selection in the Basal Ganglia - Guthrie et al, 2013

nifshowcase.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/85/nifneurolex.png)

A repository for information, scripts and configuration files which demonstrate the interactions possible between [NIF](https://www.neuinfo.org), [NeuroLex](http://neurolex.org/wiki/Main_Page) and OSB.

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
nifshowcase.name: NIF and NeuroLex Showcase

ninemlshowcase.Status info: Currently testing mapping of NeuroML/LEMS to NineML and SpineML.
ninemlshowcase.description:
![](/attachments/download/53/image_mini.png)

Examples of models in [NineML](http://software.incf.org/software/nineml) (and the related language [SpineML](http://bimpa.group.shef.ac.uk/SpineML/index.php/Home)) and conversion to/from NeuroML/LEMS.

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
ninemlshowcase.name: NineML Showcase

norenbergetal2010_dgbasketcell.Tags: Hippocampal formation,Detailed cell model,Passive model,Interneuron,Dentate gyrus
norenbergetal2010_dgbasketcell.name: DG Basket Cell - Norenberg et al. 2010

nwbshowcase.description: Showcasing the interaction with [Neurodata Without Borders (NWB)](https://www.nwb.org) format experimental data on OSB.
nwbshowcase.name: NWB Showcase

olfactory-bulb.description: A detailed network model of part of the rat olfactory bulb comprising compartmental mitral, granule and PG cells developed by Aditya Gilra and Upinder S. Bhalla (manuscript in preparation, 16 Apr 2013). The cell morphologies and network connections are in NeuroML v1.8.
olfactory-bulb.name: Olfactory Bulb

olfactory-bulb-network-model-o-connor-an.Status info: neuroConstruct version of model being updated to allow simulation on NEURON & GENESIS
olfactory-bulb-network-model-o-connor-an.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/92/Mitral_Cell_Model.png)
A model of olfactory bulb mitral cells connected by apical dendrite gap junctions in a glomerular network
olfactory-bulb-network-model-o-connor-an.name: Olfactory Bulb Network Model - O'Connor, Angelo and Jacob 2012

pinskyrinzelmodel.Tags: Hippocampal formation,CA3,Two compartment model,Google Summer of Code
pinskyrinzelmodel.description:
Reduced CA3 cell model from [Pinsky & Rinzel, Intrinsic and network rhythmogenesis in a reduced Traub model for CA3 neurons, Journal of Computational Neuroscience, 1994, Volume 1, Issue 1-2, pp 39-60](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/BF00962717).

For more details, see the [Wiki](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/pinskyrinzelmodel/wiki).
pinskyrinzelmodel.name: Reduced CA3 model - Pinsky and Rinzel 1994

piriformcortexvanier.Status info: In the process of being converted based on information in Mike Vanier's PhD thesis
piriformcortexvanier.description: A conversion to NeuroML of the Piriform Cortex pyramidal cell model developed by Mike Vanier on GENESIS, see [here](http://users.cms.caltech.edu/~mvanier/science/parampaper/param.html).
piriformcortexvanier.name: Piriform Cortex Pyramidal Neuron

pospischiletal2008.Tags: neuroConstruct,Single compartment conductance based neuron model,Pyramidal cell,Google Summer of Code
pospischiletal2008.description: Conversion to NeuroML of cell models from: [Minimal Hodgkin–Huxley type models for different classes of cortical and thalamic neurons](http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00422-008-0263-8), Martin Pospischil, Maria Toledo-Rodriguez, Cyril Monier, Zuzanna Piwkowska, Thierry Bal, Yves Frégnac, Henry Markram and Alain Destexhe, Biological Cybernetics, 2008.
pospischiletal2008.name: Minimal HH models - Pospischil et al. 2008

potjansdiesmann2014.Status info:
NEST SLI and PyNEST versions are available, matching those in the main NEST distribution version 2.12. 

A version compatible with PyNN 0.8 is available here:
https://github.com/NeuralEnsemble/PyNN/tree/master/examples/Potjans2014
potjansdiesmann2014.Tags: Large scale network simulation,Point neuron network,Integrate and fire neuron
potjansdiesmann2014.name: Spiking cortical network model - Potjans and Diesmann 2014

purkinjecell.Status info: Converted to NeuroML based on a conversion of the original GENESIS model to NEURON by Arnd Roth and colleagues. Close agreement between GENESIS & NEURON but not perfect. Conversion process has revealed a number of implementation issues with original model (e.g. table discretisation for Ca dependence in KC channel). Many channels in NeuroML implementation still in earlier version of ChannelML.
purkinjecell.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/28/shutterbower94.png)
An initial implementation in NeuroML of the Purkinje Cell model from De Schutter, E. and Bower, J. M. (1994). Based on Arnd Roth el al’s conversion of the original GENESIS code to NEURON. Note: conversion not fully complete.
purkinjecell.name: Purkinje Cell - De Schutter and Bower 1994

pyloricnetwork.Status info: In development. Cell models converted to NeuroML. Network converted, but used chemical synapses as opposed to graded synapses.
pyloricnetwork.description:
Implementation of the pyloric network of the lobster stomatogastric ganglion system of Prinz, Marder, et al.

Work in progress! For more details see the [[Wiki]].
pyloricnetwork.name: Pyloric pacemaker network - Prinz et al. 2003/04

rothmanetalkoleetalpyrcell.Status info: Rothman et al 2009 used cell in neuroConstruct with original mod files (File based cell mechanisms). Channels converted to ChannelML, but full cell needs further testing in NeuroML/GENESIS/MOOSE.
rothmanetalkoleetalpyrcell.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/29/rothman2009.png)
A project which was used in Rothman et al. “Synaptic depression enables neuronal gain control” Nature 2009 to demonstrate gain control in realistic cell models. Based on cell model from Kole et al. 2008 (obtained from http://senselab.med.yale.edu/modeldb/ShowModel.asp?model=114394).
rothmanetalkoleetalpyrcell.name: L5 Pyramidal cell - Rothman et al. 2009

sbmlshowcase.Status info: In development in line with org.neuroml.import/export packages.
sbmlshowcase.description:
![](/attachments/download/55/Official-sbml-supported-70.jpg)

OSB showcase of interactions between SBML and NeuroML/LEMS.

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
sbmlshowcase.name: SBML Showcase

striatalspinyprojectionneuron.Status info: In development. Avrama Blackwell's lab is building a new SSPN model in GENESIS and various elements of the model are being converted to NeuroML 2 here to test the scope of the model description language.
striatalspinyprojectionneuron.Tags: Single compartment conductance based neuron model,Goldman-Hodgkin-Katz current
striatalspinyprojectionneuron.description:
[Striatal spiny projection neuron](http://neurolex.org/wiki/Category:Neostriatum_direct_pathway_spiny_neuron) model being developed by Avrama Blackwell. A version of this model in “pure” NeuroML v2.0 is being developed here.

For more information, see the [[Wiki]]
striatalspinyprojectionneuron.name: Striatal Spiny Projection Neuron - Blackwell

tcrelay-neuron-in-high-conductance-state.name: TCrelay neuron in high conductance state  - Zeldenrust et al. 2018

thalamocortical.Status info:
Single cell models are stable in NeuroML v1.8.1, NEURON, GENESIS, MOOSE. [Mappings to NeuroML v2.0](https://github.com/OpenSourceBrain/Thalamocortical/tree/master/NeuroML2) are in an advanced state of development.

The large scale networks from Traub et al 2005 are in the process of being ported, see the wiki for more details.
thalamocortical.Tags: Detailed cell model,Pyramidal cell,Large scale network simulation,High Performance Computing,neuroConstruct,Gap junctions,Interneuron
thalamocortical.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/125/Column3_S.png)
This is a project implementing cells from the thalamocortical network model of Traub et al 2005 in NeuroML. Based on the NEURON implementation from: http://senselab.med.yale.edu/ModelDB/ShowModel.asp?model=45539.

The [[Wiki]] gives details of running this project with neuroConstruct.
thalamocortical.name: Thalamocortical network - Traub et al. 2005

thevirtualbrainshowcase.description:
![](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/attachments/download/177/Logo_VB.png)

Repository for an OSB project to show the interaction between neural mass models implemented in [The Virtual Brain](http://www.thevirtualbrain.org) and how they can make use of model based description languages like NeuroML
thevirtualbrainshowcase.name: The Virtual Brain Showcase

tvb_neuroml.description: Project to test scenarios for [TVB](http://www.thevirtualbrain.org) & NeuroML interoperability
tvb_neuroml.name: TVB NeuroML

v1networkmodels.Status info: Implements a significant part of pubmed:9671678. See the [Wiki](http://www.opensourcebrain.org/projects/v1networkmodels/wiki) for full details.
v1networkmodels.Tags: Point neuron network,Google Summer of Code,Visual system
v1networkmodels.description:
<To edit this description, change README.md in the GitHub repository>
github:README.md
v1networkmodels.name: Network models of V1

vervaekeetalgolgicellnetwork.Status info: Well tested mapping from NeuroML v1.8.1 -> NEURON. KAHP channel with kinetic scheme formalism precludes use on GENESIS/MOOSE for now. Calcium dynamics prevent using this model on PSICS.
vervaekeetalgolgicellnetwork.name: Golgi Cell Network - Vervaeke et al 2010

vfb_showcase.Status info: Mapping of VFB morphologies to NeuroML being tested.
vfb_showcase.description:
![](/attachments/download/46/flyBrain.gif)

Showcase of some *Drosophila melanogaster* neuronal morphologies processed by [Virtual Fly Brain](http://www.virtualflybrain.org) team. These will likely include examples based on raw data available from http://flybrain.stanford.edu and http://flycircuit.tw.
vfb_showcase.name: Virtual Fly Brain Showcase

vierlingclaassenetal2010.Status info: In early stages of conversion to NeuroML
vierlingclaassenetal2010.name: VierlingClaassenEtAl2010

vogelsetal2011.Tags: Google Summer of Code,Point neuron network,Inhibition
vogelsetal2011.description:
![](/attachments/download/107/test_full.png)

Network model from: Vogels TP, Sprekeler H, Zenke F, Clopath C, Gerstner W (2011) [Inhibitory plasticity balances excitation and inhibition in sensory pathways and memory networks](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/334/6062/1569.abstract). Science 334:1569-73.

See the [[Wiki]] for more details.
vogelsetal2011.name: Balanced network with inhibitory plasticity - Vogels et al. 2011

weileretal08-laminarcortex.Status info: Currently converting model from Matlab to Python
weileretal08-laminarcortex.name: Laminar organization of motor cortex - Weiler et al 2008
